intro: Micromeria chamissonis, commonly known as the California sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in coastal and inland desert environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
